choices.B: Create a help desk Workspace mail account, and set the help desk team as mail delegates to the help desk account.
choices.D: In Google Drive, create a help desk request form, and give the help desk team the ability to view the inbound requests.
choices.C: Create the help desk group as a Q&A Group, and add the "Manager" role to the help desk team users.
choices.A: Configure a Google Group as a collaborative inbox, and assign the required Groups permissions to the help desk team members.

questions.question_text: As the Workspace Administrator, you have been asked to enable the help desk team to share incoming support requests from end users. The help desk team has ten users who need to respond to support requests that are sent to a help desk email address. The users must be able to respond by email and assign ownership of tickets. Finally, the help desk team is highly mobile and will need to manage help desk tickets from their mobile devices. How would you provide this functionality for the help desk team?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Configure a Google Group as a collaborative inbox, and assign the required Groups permissions to the help desk team members.

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B. Create a help desk Workspace mail account, and set the help desk team as mail delegates to the help desk account.

This option will allow all members of the help desk team to see and respond to incoming support requests, even if they are not the original recipient of the email. They will also be able to assign ownership of tickets to each other, which is important for managing tickets from mobile devices.

Option A is incorrect because it would only allow one member of the help desk team to see and respond to incoming support requests.

Option C is incorrect because Q&A Groups are not designed for managing incoming support requests.

Option D is incorrect because it would not allow the help desk team to respond to incoming support requests.

Selected Answer: A
To provide the functionality required for the help desk team to share, respond, and manage support requests from end-users, the most suitable option is Option A

Selected Answer: A
A seems correct. 
Creating emails accounts for such purposes goes against a proper licenses management.

Selected Answer: A
A seems fine

Selected Answer: A
I guess A

questions.question_text:
Your company is using Google Workspace Business Plus edition, and the security team has reported several unsuccessful attempts to sign in to your Google Workspace domain from countries where you have no local employees. The affected accounts are from several executives in the main office.

You are asked to take measures to mitigate this security risk. Although budget is not a concern, your company prefers a minimal financial outlay to fix the issue, which you are tasked with managing. Which two solutions would help you mitigate the risk at minimal cost? (Choose two.)

choices.E: For all executives, create new accounts with random characters to match Google best practices, migrate data from the former accounts, and then delete them.
choices.A: Deploy 2-Step Verification for all users who have security keys.
choices.B: Deploy Google Cloud Armor on a dedicated project, and create a rule to allow access to Google Workspace only from specific locations.
choices.C: Upgrade to Google Workspace Enterprise Plus for all accounts, and define Context-Aware Access levels to only a list of countries where the company has employees.
choices.D: Subscribe to Cloud Identity Premium for all accounts, and define Context-Aware Access levels to only a list of countries where the company has employees.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Deploy 2-Step Verification for all users who have security keys AND Subscribe to Cloud Identity Premium for all accounts, and define Context-Aware Access levels to only a list of countries where the company has employees.

Selected Answer: AD
A. Deploy 2-Step Verification for all users who have security keys.
D. Subscribe to Cloud Identity Premium for all accounts, and define Context-Aware Access levels to only a list of countries where the company has employees.
AD is correct, CIP is $7.20 per license while the Enteprise Plus suscription is $21.60.

Selected Answer: AD
Answers are A & D
Cloud Identity Premium is almost the cheapest option to enable Context-Aware Access on any Google Cloud license. (almost because Ent. Standard is cheaper than Business Plus + CIP)

B. Google Cloud Armor is a network security service that provides defenses against DDoS.
C. Google Workspace Enterprise Plus is too fancy. Enterprise Standard would have been a better choice with same level of features than Business Plus (Vault, Adv Mobile management, DLP and Context-Aware access) 
E. Accounts with random characters is non-sense and doesn't match any Google best practices

Selected Answer: AD
Agree, A,D make minimal cost

Selected Answer: CD
Vote CD. Context-Aware access only available as stated:
"Supported editions for this feature: Frontline Standard; Enterprise Standard and Enterprise Plus; Education Standard and Education Plus; Enterprise Essentials Plus; Cloud Identity Premium."
A: No. The customer might not request 2SV but still want to restrict locations. Plus, no info that enabling Identity Premium needs 2SV.
B: No. Workspace is a SaaS; Google Cloud Armor can't intercept it.
E: No. Not relevant.
https://support.google.com/a/answer/9275380?sjid=1346886938548748908-AP

Selected Answer: AD
AD - key word minimal cost so not C

Selected Answer: CD
Google wants us to use the mentioned services. There mitigate costs. for those choosing A, it's not proper as is only secures the accounts of employees who have security keys

Selected Answer: AD
AD is the correct Answer!

To mitigate the security risk of unsuccessful sign-in attempts from countries where your company has no local employees

Selected Answer: AB
I would say AB... because: C is expensive and in D context-aware access is in Enterprise plans (and ID premium licenses are also an additional cost)

Selected Answer: AD
minimal costs

questions.question_text: You have enabled Automatic Room Replacement for your calendar resources, but it is not working for any instances of a conflict booking. What could be the issue?

choices.A: Automatic Room Replacement does not work on recurring events.
choices.B: This feature requires calendar event owners to have the Buildings and resources administrator privilege.
choices.C: The calendar resources do not have the Resource Category configured as CONFERENCE_ROOM.
choices.D: The events have more than 20 attendees.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Use automatic room replacement
Automatic room replacement is on by default, but it only replaces rooms when both of the following conditions are met:
- Rooms are defined as structured resources and classified as meeting spaces.
- Users have their work locations set, and rooms are structured resources in their buildings.

https://support.google.com/a/answer/9682138?hl=en

Selected Answer: C
https://support.google.com/a/answer/9682138?hl=en

Selected Answer: C
C. The calendar resources do not have the Resource Category configured as CONFERENCE_ROOM.

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer as per this : https://support.google.com/a/answer/9682138?hl=en
One of the requirement for a room to be replaced is that it should have a correct type

I'm voting for A:

Also, if a room declines:

A series of recurring events—Only one email is sent.
One in a series of recurring events (an exception)—Calendar sends up to 5 emails, one for each exception. If there are more than 5, then the whole series is declined.
